Quote: A shooting star! Quick Snowy, wish!
A star too many in the Great Bear... It beats me!
It looks like a huge ball of fire...
This is it! The end of the world!!
Hooray! It's only an earthquake!
Hooray! The end of the world has been postponed!
The dynamite! The crazy fool! He's taken the dynamite!
This will blow away the cobwebs, eh, Snowy? What wonderful air...
What?... A breeze? Isn't this a gale?
I'm glad to hear it. I thought you were going to kill each other!
He's as mad as a hatter!
I'm going to cause a sensation!
Quick, we must get a move on!
I don't want to go in the water!... Wow!... Wow!
Come on out, centipede! Let's see you in the daylight!
Come down, by thunder, or I'll have you clapped in irons!
Thundering typhoons!
ALL HANDS ABOARD SHIP!... We sail at once.
They'll find the sea-legs in a day or two...
Pirates! Shipwreckers! Sea-lice! Filibusters! Hoodlums! Road-hogs! Freshwater swabs!
Me? A semaphore?... You, why you're nothing but a...
Ten thousand thundering typhoons!
Gang of thieves! Black marketeers! Monopolizers! Turncoats! Ophicleides! Colosynths!
Let me go! I'm going to tear those caterpillars into little pieces!
Billions of blue blistering barnacles!... Dratted animal!... Wait till I catch the little pirate!
Come on! We shall see what we shall see!... Show a leg! On deck with you!
Worse than that!... We're out of whisky!
This is the life, Snowy. A really quiet holiday for a change...
What a strange fellow!
No! No! Never in a thousand years! No one's going to turn me into a mummy!
My name? It won't mean a thing to you but at home they call me Tintin.
Amazing what a little publicity will do for you!
There aren't any wells on our way. And the desert spells death without water.
You see, one should never give up hope!
Marvellous... You mean dull as ditchwater!... Why doesn't someone fall overboard to brighten things up?
It's going to take more than that to catch me!
Hooray, I've learnt to talk Elephant!
We arrest you in the name of the law!
I smell danger: there's dirty work somewhere round here...
Bother! We were mistaken! To be precise we're a mistake.
Goodness gracious! It's the ticket collecter! To be precise: we've collected a ticket!
He's gone: it's all clear. To be precise: the all clear's gone!
We heard about it, so this is where we are. To be precise: so where are we?
A dart... Dipped in Rajaijah juice... The poison of madness?!
Quick! Speak! What you have to tell me?
Great snakes!... He can't have been kidnapped!
Bit speedy round here, eh?
Officer, I found this poor madman. Can you take care of him?
An opium den? Right! I'll be there tonight...
Crumbs, it's cold... Now what are they doing?... Taking cover?... I wonder...
Mad!... I'm going to go mad!
Chick... Chick... Chick... Chicken!
There isn't a moment to lose... I must get out of the city...
You saved my life. I shall never forget...
Well, that's torn it. Now I know what's in store for me.
Oh well, I've nothing to lose...
But Chang, all white men aren't wicked. You see, different peoples don't know enough about eachother.
Hands up gangster, or I'll 'photograph' you at point blank range!
Ha! Ha! None of that fell on deaf ears!...
Great snakes! We've come out through a safe!...
Yes, I'm inclined to agree!
What about a cup of tea for me?
Don't look now, but something tells me we're being followed...
Vanished!... Vaporized!... Poor Captain! How dreadful!
Captain! Snowy's picked up a scent. Come on, let's follow him.
Great snakes! The wounded man... he's vanished!
Go on, Snowy! seek it out!
Captain, I propose we crack a bottle of champagne in honour of these gentlemen.
Gentlemen, a toast to Borduria and her glorious ruler, Marshal Kurvi-Tasch!
It's true, Captain. When you're in a crowd there's always less chance of being noticed.
Ah, peace and quiet! ... How quiet it is here... Just listen to it...
Billions of bilious blue blistering barnacles! Now the electricity has gone! That's the last straw!
He can go to the devil - him, and his insurance, and his Uncle Anatole!
In heaven's name, what's the matter now?
...TIN...BLOP...BLUB...PLOB
Road-hog!... Steam-roller!... Bully!... Dipsomaniac!... Nitwit!
Just look at that horde of rubbernecs!
You clumsy oaf, are you suggesting it was my fault?
Lucky for you I'm in a hurry!
Yes, in a hurry, you ectoplasmic by-product! Otherwise...
Carpathian caterpillar! Just wait till I see him again!
Brutes!... Filibusters!... Nitwits!... Steam-rollers!... Abecedarians!
Your wise has rare distinction.
Nit-witted ninepins! Bashi-bazouks! A "C.D." plate, so do as you like! Certified Diplodocuses, that's what you are!
Gansters!... Anacoluthons!... Bashi-bazouks!
Blackguard!... Egoists!... Nitwits!... Troglodytes!... Polygraphs!
Beasts!... Autocrats!... Profiteers!... Fat faces!... Tramps!
Old Calculus has certainly led us pretty dance around the countyside!
Incredible!... Fantastic!... That's upset the apple-cart!
You can rely on us; "Mum's the word". That's our motto. Yes, "Dumb's the word." That's our motto.
My umbrella! My own little umbrella! At last I've found you!
And the cream of the joke is, without these plans the Bordurians can't do a thing!
Chicken-pox?? ... At your age? ... Goodness!
Aha, you little flaterer, so you've come to congratulate me, with this... this fisherman... Mr? ... Mr? ...
I'm terribly sorry, I must have dropped off... I had a horrible nightmare...
Champagne? At this hour?
He's alive, I tell you! I'm packing my bag and leaving for Nepal.
Captain, stop! Not there! Here! The other steps!
Fruit?... Good to eat?... Nice and Sweet?... Yum-yum?
W-w-what happened? I ate one of those things. It was just like swallowing a volcano in full blast!
Please, please... Watch your language! I didn't shout at you, did I?
Captain, what can I say? You're a marvel!
Whisky, by thunder! What about those bottles in my pack?
I... I don't know... I must have fallen asleep on my feet... The heat, I expect... I think I was dreaming...
Bianca Castafiore!... She's HERE, by thunder! That woman follows us to the ends of the earth!
Billions of blistering barnacles! It's about time they made a tent to stay up without all these fiddling bits of string!!
What are all those four shouting about?... Someting wrong?
To the bridge! It's our one chance of saving him!
Oh, there you are. So you managed to rescue the old drunkard?
My whisky... safe... That's the main thing!
The yeti! The Abominable Snowman!!
The Abominable Snowman! That's a good one! Don't make me laugh! Fairy stories... old wives' tales! Who's ever seen this famous yeti?
Fiddle-faddle! You're imagining things... it's only the wind... But here's something real enough: a bottle of whisky!
My beard! It's caught in the zip!
Rubbish! What sort of village idiot d'you take me for? Half-baked Haddock?
The yeti drinks whisky! I expect he plays the bagpipes too!
My whisky, you Cro-Magnon!... My whisky, you Mameluke, you!... Vampire!... Dipsomaniac!... Body-snatcher!
You odd-toad ungulate!... Macrocephalic baboon!... Phylloxera!... Cannibal!
Diplodocus! ... Filibuster! ... Megalomaniac!
Abandoning ship! ... The lily-livered bandicoots!
No good! ... Not a sound! The noise of the wind is drowning my voice. And it's getting dark, too. What'll become of us now, Snowy?
A crevasse! Crumbs, Snowy, that was a near thing!
I advise him to keep his distance, the drunken old ape!
Blistering yetis, it's the barnacle! ... I mean... Yettering barnacles, it's the blister... up there... I mean... the yeti!
It's sheer lunacy, but I'll go with you. I've got a little score to settle with that pithecanthropic pickpocket up there!
Did you say... er... brandy? You've still got some brandy?
I suppose they think I've got wings!
What's that jackass doing out of doors at this hour?
It'd take more than an earthquake to shift me!
Go, Snowy, go!... Our lives depend upon you! Go on, quickly!
Golly, what a magnificent bone!... It's certainly a five-star model! What a bone!
Come with me! We must save Tintin!
Pity! Too late to snap the flying father! He's come down to earth!
Very well, I'll go alone if necessary. My friend is in danger. You can't expect me to desert him now.
Help! Fire! Murder! Whatever shall I do?
What happened?... An atom bomb, wasn't it?... Are we all dead?
So there you are, you ante-diluvian bulldozer!... Come closer, if you dare, you jobbernowl, and I'll turn you into a hearth-rug!
MEGACYCLE! PYROMANIAC!
I've a hunch that we're off on one of our adventures again...
Burgled twice in one day... Not bad at all!
Tintin, you're a real Sherlock Holmes!
Treasure, Snowy!... Come on, this is going to be a treasure-hunt!
Avast, you dogs!... Sea-gherkins!... Baboons!
Buccaneers!... Filibusters!... Bagpipers!... Gallows-Fodder!
It is the year 1676. The UNICORN , a valiant ship of King Charles II's fleet, has left Barbados in the West Indies, and set sail for home.
The red pennant!... No quarter given!... A fight to the death, no prisoners taken!... You understand?
Here they come! Grapling irons are hurled from the enemy ship. With hideous yells the pirates stream aboard the UNICORN
Back, you rats! Avast, sea-lice! Belay, lubberly scum!
Darkness fell; the pirates found the UNICORN's cargo of rum, broached the casks, and made themselves abominable drunk...
Suddenly, nimbly parrying a thrust, he leapt to one side...
That's it, Captain!... Red Rackham's treasure will be ours!
Thundering typhoons! We aren't the only ones hunting for Red Rackham's treasure!
I'm sorry. We're on duty. On duty we can have no friends!
Now, if there's a victim, there must be a culprit. A brilliant deduction! Now we only have to find him...
Artichokes!... Vermicellis!... Phylloxera!... Pyrographers!
Crab-apples!... Goosecaps!... Gogglers!... Jelly-fish!
Look!... Your corpse is coming around!
Sparrows?... What do you mean?... Crumbs, he's fainted!...
So do I, Captain. It's all very mysterious. "To be precise: very mysterious", as the Thomsons would say.
My wallet!... This time I've got you, you scoundrel!
Got you my friend!... And I'm not letting you go!
It looks very much as if I'm a prisoner...
Eureka!
A quick bath and I'll soon get rid of this mud.
The joke's over, you gangsters! Hands up!
Snowy! Good old Snowy!... You managed to find me!
Ha, bully!... Ha, pirate!... Ha, pickled herring!
That thug had come around - he was just going to shoot you...
Property of Thomson... property of Thompson... Thomson... Thompson... Thomson... Thompson... Thomson... Thompson...
Here, Thompsons, hold my stick while I just deal with this gentleman...
Please speak a bit louder. I'm a little hard of hearing.
I'm delighted to meet you. My name is Calculus. Cuthbert Calculus.
Yes, that's a new device for putting bubbles in soda-water...
But anyway, now we are aboard you will be able to feel that you are perfectly safe. To be precise: perfectly safe.
We must behave like old sea-dogs...
It's him, Tintin!... He's stolen my pillow! That's not true! It's him - he's taken one of my blankets!
Steaming blood! There's not a drop of whisky aboard! If I catch the monster who played this trick on us, he'll be in for a rough time!...
All right... You... you want a d-d-d-drink too?
Wretch!... Ignoramus!... Abominable Snowman!... I'll throw you overboard! Overboard, d'you hear?...
I mean, gentlemen, that according to your calculations we are now standing inside Westminster Abbey!
Coxswain at the wheel!... Helm hard a-port!... Midships!... Steer due east.
There it is at last! Our treasure island!
Eaten?... Do you mean cannibals lived on this island?... Man-eaters?
Your gun!... Give me your gun!... I'm going to turn them into parrot soup.
Blistering baboons!... Monkeys!... Gibbons!... Orang-outangs!... Give us back that gun, cercopithecuses!
Thing's look bad, Snowy! Our propeller is entangled in the weeds!
No, but I was a great sportsman in my youth...
Thundering typhoons, I'm trying to! What do you think I'm doing? Playing the cornet?
You infernal impersonations of abominable snowmen! Pump for your lives!... Faster!
A bottle of rum, my friends!... Jamaica rum, and it's more than two hundred and fifty years old!... Just you taste it!
You never ordered us to stop pumping, Captain. Sw here we are, pumping. To be precise: we're pumping.
Off to bed, nitwits! You'll have plenty more pumping believe me!
A casket!... A casket!... Red Rackham's treasure! Red Rackham's treasure!!... Here it is at last!
These are old documents!... Definitely!... Old documents!
Yes, it's all your fault, you certified ignoramus!
You see that, eh? I suppose it's the figure-head of the TITANIC!
Well, what do you say, now, my friends? All's well that ends well, eh?
Just as I always said: more to the west!
You've read this brochure on Syldavia?... What a country!... They export mineral-water, the poisoners!...
What are you doing?... Not one drop of that disgusting mineral-water in my whisky!
Sea-gherking!... Pirate!... Logarithm!.. Baboon!... You call youself a policeman and you can't open a bottle properly!
Here's to you!... Ha! ha! ha! Passengers for the moon, all aboard the bus!... Sorry, the rocket!... You are taking passengers, I hope?
Just when is someone going to let me out of this fancy-dress?
It's about time someone took interest in me!
Great snakes! It went off in the professor's room! Quick! I must hurry!
There you go! Acrobatics again! You'll break every bone in your body one day!
Now keep calm!... No one leave the room!... And Dont't picnic... I mean panic... We'll proceed with caution... and look around...
And now the great vituoso Haddocksikoff... Pom Pom Pom Pompity Pom
The Moon and back!... Do you realise what those little words mean: THE MOON AND BACK!
The wonders of modern science!... Just an ordinary lever, and click!... Hundreds of thousands of miles away an engine starts up!... It's fantastic!
I beg your pardon, but I've followed you exactly!... I'm not deaf, am I?
Be brave, Cuthbert!... Now you must destroy your whole life's work!... There!
Oh misery!... Misery!... All is lost!... Our secrets, our discoveries, lost!... Everything will drop into foreign hands!... This is appalling!
M-m-m... m-mice!... It's alive with mice in here!
To dare say such a thing to me!... You!... You follow me... I'll show you just how I act the goat!... Come along!
Begone, you worm! Out of my sight! I'm acting the goat. d'you hear?
I often say to myself: one of these days I'll learn to drive! Nowadays everyone shold be able to drive a car!
You road-hog!... Bully!... Steamroller!... Cyclotron!
You think this... this crackpot contraption will take you to the moon?...
And he just sits there looking at me, the jelly-fish! You couldn't be frightened, could you? You moth-eaten marmot!
A goat!... A goat!... You dare call me a goat!... This is too much! You're not getting away with that!
Why on earth should I look happy? Because we're off to the Moon?
Well Tintin old man, you've lived through plenty of adventures... But I wonder if this isn't going to be your last!
Hoity toity! Aren't we grand!
Thomson and Thompson! What are those nitwits doing here?
Putting a ship in quarantine, you landlubber, means keping her in isolation for some time, to avoid risk of infection.
That sounds like the telephone. To be precise: the telephone.
You can't be asleep, you're talkning to me! You know very well that I talk in my sleep!
It's like looking for a needle in a haystack. To be precise: we look like needles in a haystack.
Aren't you ashamed?... Bullying a child like that?
And fee-fi-fo-fum... And since you're so worried about my friend Tintin, take a look behind you!
Blistering barnacles, what's going on?... He's hanging on to the condor's legs!... By thunder, what next?
Pirate!... Doryphore!... Gobbledygook! Just wait till I get you to the taxidermist, you bald-headed budgerigar!
Brrr! it's freezing!... You bet I'll catch a cold... There, what did I say?... Aaaah!... Aaaah!...
Wait, Captain, not so fast!... Don't drink it all!
Be off with you, slubberdegulions!
Patagonians!... Bashi-bazouks! Carpet-sellers! Kleptomaniacs!...
You know Zorrino, the Captain's guardian angel has a full-time job!
Good old Snowy! You've managed to dig out the Captain's cap.
Stop!... Look, there's a cave!... Why don't we spend the night here?
Hop it, you four-legged Cyrano!
This beastly steaming jungle!... Will it never end?
Tintin!... Tintin!... Is is really you?... Where are you?
Davy Jones, here I come!
It's incredible!... Extraordinary!... Amazing!... Fantastic!
No noise, now!... Careful!... I've got a hunch we're nearly at the end of out journey.
Inca mummies! We certainly are in a tomb!
Golly! Whatever next? A musical bone!
Sea-gherkins!... Ectoplasms!... Poltroons!... Politicians!... Doryphores!... Terrorists!
Be put to death!... D'you really think we'll let ourselves be massacred, just like that, you tin-hatted tyrant?!
My pipe!... My poor pipe!... Blistering barnacles, it's broken!
Snowy!... stop fooling around... That's enough!... Come here!
E U R E K A !
Me? Put on that Patagonian petticoat? Never!
Never! d'you hear?... And when I say never, I mean never!
Unless I'm much mistaken, there's something very fishy going on.
Stay, Huascar!... The Sun God will not hear your prayers!
O Sun, lord of the day, show mercy, I pray thee... Pity thy children and show thy light once more!
Me too, old salt, I swear too!... May my rum be rationed and my beard be barbecued if I breathe so much as a word!
Me too; I swear I will never act in another film, however glittering the contract Hollywood may offer me. You have my word.
Water?... The Captain drinking water?... I'd never have believed the day would come!
